briefing.admin_logi:
[b]Sustainment[/b]
Class III/V 0730 (no live HE). Aid/medevac simulated via UMPIRE.

[b]Calls:[/b]
- Lane control = [b]RANGE[/b]
- Medevac = [b]UMPIRE[/b]
briefing.execution:
[b]Commander’s Intent:[/b] Safe, by-the-book reps, clean radio work and zero vehicle/safety incidents.

[b]Concept:[/b]
- L1 (Comms/CP): Net check, graphics, TRPs.
- L2 (Movement/Contact): React to ambush, report, smoke, bound.
- L3 (Break Contact): Screen and disengage to next PL.
- L4 (River-Crossing): Engineer drill—emplace/clear training bridge; traffic control.
- AAR/Refit.

[b]Tasks:[/b]
- Scout Plt (1/A): Lead lanes, trigger contacts and report.
- Tank Plt (2/A): Overwatch and base-of-fire.
- AT/TOW Sec: Demonstrate engagement.
- Mortar Sec: On-call smoke/illum (simulated) per FSO.
- Engr Plt (58th Engr Co): Crossing site, demo procedures.

objectives.success: Perform a radio check and receive a reply.
objectives.title: Lane 1: Perform Radio Check

objectives.success: Ask for a position report and place unit markers for each unit.
objectives.title: Lane 1: Place unit markers

objectives.success: Draw movement plan for Training Lane 2.
objectives.title: Lane 1: Draw movement plan

objectives.success: The unit must report contact and status, destroy one enemy platoon and break contact with the second.
objectives.title: Lane 2: Practice Combat

objectives.success: Have engineers build a bridge east of OBJ 3.
objectives.title: Lane 3: Build Bridge

objectives.success: Call artillery barrage of smoke to cover unit movement
objectives.title: Lane 3: Call for smoke barrage

objectives.success: Have a friendly unit cross the bridge from east to west and move to OBJ 3.
objectives.title: Lane 3: Move across bridge

mission.statement: At 0900C 05 NOV 83, A Trp/1-11 ACR (-) conducts a four-lane evaluation at Wildflecken to rehearse comms discipline, movement under contact, break-contact with smoke, and river crossing in order to certify the troop GO for follow-on taskings.

situation.enemy: Mech platoon (OPFOR roleplayers) simulating NVA tactics. May inject recon probes, hasty ambush, and mortar smoke (simulated).
situation.friendly:
- A Troop, 1-11 ACR (-) with attached Engineer Platoon
- Bundeswehr Observers
- Range Control / UMPIRE
situation.terrain: Forrested ridges, open fields, shallow lake, shallow river crossing.

briefing.title: FTX Crested Cap Checkride

triggers.title: Radio Check Response
Mission Init
Drawing Check
Timer Check
Unit Counter Check
Alpha Move Check
Combat Trigger
Ambush Reports Trigger
VICTOR Destroyed Trigger
Ambush Contact Break Trigger
Bridge Trigger
Artillery trigger
Alpha Retreat Trigger

description:
A routine lane evaluation at Wildflecken caps a week of Autumn Forge drills. Range Control wants clean radio work, safe bounds, and a pretty AAR for visiting brass. Your troop runs the lanes, pops smoke on cue, and rehearses river drills with engineers who’ve done this a hundred times. 

The only tension is the weather and the stopwatch—until distant artillery thumps roll in from the border. Umpires shrug it off as another unit’s live-fire. Your RTO doesn’t like the pattern; neither do you.

"It’s just an exercise—until it isn’t."
title: Crested Cap Checkride
